style.name: American-Style India Pale Ale
style.description: American-style India pale ales are perceived to have medium-high to intense hop bitterness, flavor and aroma with medium-high alcohol content. The style is further characterized by floral, fruity, citrus-like, piney, resinous, or sulfur-like American-variety hop character. Note that one or more of these American-variety hop characters is the perceived end, but the hop characters may be a result of the skillful use of hops of other national origins. The use of water with high mineral content results in a crisp, dry beer. This pale gold to deep copper-colored ale has a full, flowery hop aroma and may have a strong hop flavor (in addition to the perception of hop bitterness). India pale ales possess medium maltiness which contributes to a medium body. Fruity-ester flavors and aromas are moderate to very strong. Diacetyl can be absent or may be perceived at very low levels. Chill and/or hop haze is allowable at cold temperatures. (English and citrus-like American hops are considered enough of a distinction justifying separate American-style IPA and English-style IPA categories or subcategories. Hops of other origins may be used for bitterness or approximating traditional American or English character. See English-style India Pale Ale

breweries.name: Final Gravity Brewing Co.

data.name: THe RUSH
data.description: The more hops in the beer the gooder it is. Yes, but by the same token the more brett in the beer the gooder it is also.  Simcoe hops…..mmmm, Mosaic hops…..yuuuum, Nelson Sauvin hops…..dribble dribble.  Got THe RUSH yet?  Or perhaps that’s just wild yeast in your beer.  This IPA is entirely fermented with a brett strain isolated from Brussels called Brettanomyces Bruxellensis Trois. You won’t find any horse-blankets here, instead this brett strain exhibits characteristics of mango and pineapple that intermingle with the hops into a harmonious cacophony of fruity goodness.  It’s like looking into the eye of a duck and sucking all the fluid from its beak.  Enjoy!

breweries.name: 7 Cent Brewery
breweries.description:
7 cent Brewery is owned and operated by three engineers who are beyond passionate about beer.   We are inspired by the craft brewers before us who have challenged the palates of beer drinkers, been brave enough to brew something unique and not follow the status quo of the beer world.
The core philosophy of the brewery is to make beer that excites us and to make beer that we love to drink.  In no way will we let supply, the market or budgeting compromise the quality of 7 cent beer.  If other people want to drink it, bathe in it, rub it on their hips and let it eat through to their liver, freeze it into ice blocks in winter and skate on it, then melt it in spring time and drink it, or whatever they decide to do with it, it’s all an added bonus for us.

breweries.name: Black Lotus Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Mark Harper, Michael Allan and his wife Jodi Allan (Mark’s sister) founded Black Lotus Brewing Company in 2006.  Their family business formed when Mark (a school psychologist and musician) and Mike (a financial planner and banker) both longed for more creative and spiritual control over their careers.  Disheartened by massive corporate entities serving up inferior products, Mark and Mike, together with Jodi (a high school educator) created the philosophy: “Think Global, Drink Local. “

Under this philosophy Black Lotus is committed to providing quality-handcrafted products to each and every one of its customers.  Furthermore, these products are to be served to the customer with timeliness, friendliness and individualized care.   In addition, Black Lotus is committed to the notion that this care should be extended to the community at large and the world when possible.  This is accomplished by supporting charitable contributions and activities that bring the world more creation, more compassion, more art, more tastefulness, and more peace.

data.name: The Scientist IPA
data.description: In the spirit of scientific inquiry we bring you an ever evolving IPA. Each batch will have a slight shift of one ingredient. One batch could have a small proportion of one malt swapped for another, the next batch may change the amount of a particular hop during the boil, a later batch may change out a hop variety entirely. Starting with a light bodied, hop forward IPA, we will take small intentional steps towards finding just the right balance of floral, citrus and tropical hop notes. For the foreseeable future, each time you taste this beer, it will be different from the last.

data.name: The Singularity Galaxy IPA
data.description: Our big, West Coast style, single malt-single hop (New Zealand Galaxy hops) IPA! This crisp and fresh brew combines the big hop and malt backbone you'd expect from the style, while still affording a surprising level of drinkablility. The hops invite you with an intense aroma of citrus and tropical fruit and once you dive into that glass you'll never look back.

breweries.name: Gravity Brewlab
breweries.description:
The brainchild of owner Diego Ganoza, Gravity Brew Lab is designed to be the answer to the question Miami has been asking for the past several years: "why can't we have creative, top quality, locally made craft beer; like most other metropolitan cities in the U.S.?"

Originally, the concept was to open a really cool beer bar, bringing beer from around the United States and Belgium and making it available for the local enthusiasts to enjoy. However, we soon realized we were somewhat limited and constrained by which beers were actually available in the Miami market -due to distribution and other factors. And since we're all about unfettered drinking and out of the box thinking, the concept soon changed to: "let's brew our own!". This way we would be free to experiment with both well known and more obscure styles and experiment with flavor profiles and combinations. The possibilities, which once looked constrained, now appeared limitless.

Enter Robert Tejon and Seth Hammond! After meeting and networking within Miami's local brewer community for the better part of a year, Diego met Robert and Seth. They decided to start making some test batches, which eventually led to making one-off pilot batches for nationally-renowned events (please see our "events" section). As momentum gathered, we realized that there was great potential in this concept and decided that the brewpub was definitely the way we wanted to go.

As Gravity Brew Lab, our mission is to bring you uncompromising, top quality beer. Our true purpose, though, is to give you a new experience every time you sit at one of our tables and ask for a glass of beer.

breweries.name: Opposition Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Opposition Brewing isn’t about doom and gloom, it’s about enjoying the time we have, while we have time left. It’s about great beer made simply. It’s about good friends, good times, and knowing that we should always live for the moment because it may all be over tomorrow.

At Opposition Brewing we love BIG beers. Be they brews with huge hop presence, big malt backbones, or prominent and unique flavor profiles, we prefer brewing and drinking beers that are approachable, but with the character necessary to challenge the mundane.

We offer a consistent selection of quality, small-batch, beers as well as rotating specialties. We brew weekly, guaranteeing some of the freshest beer on tap in the Rogue Valley. And we offer a truly unique, local, artisan experience.

We also hail from the great Pacific Northwest and choose to honor the ingredients produced here as much as possible in our brews. And while we enjoy the technology available to us now, we know that it could all go away tomorrow, so we believe in a brewing process that is distilled as far down as reasonably possible while still achieving consistently excellent results. 

So sit back, raise a pint, and let us ride this long black train together!

breweries.name: Oliphant Brewing
breweries.description:
we're pretty sure that the beer made was part ectoplasmic mud intended as a 5th dimensional chrysalis for an almost immediate and rude awakening of shrimp-kind. once fed to the prawny bastards they grow strong and stout. they're tenuous ligament connections calcify and grow stronger and they can appear to read people's minds by a simple flexing of their delicious muscles. they're tv antenna antennas probe the air and gently wave in the breeze though the touch them is as touching rough-grit sand and glass paper and leaves tiny shards similar grabbing the white paint of a fire hydrant marker. 

we had no idea. we swear. 

we're just here's to brew beer, not help with the awakening of the earth's 6th cycle of developed beings. that being said -- all hail the prawn people! may their mighty and lesser claws be bound only by their own strength of will. let the buddha shrimp click and clackle their obscene language to the world.

breweries.name: Aslin Beer Co.
breweries.description: Since the inception of Aslin Beer Company, Andrew, Kai, & Richard wanted to create a company that they all would want to work for. They have strived to create a culture that celebrates beer with a passion and depth of knowledge that can’t help but be contagious to our customers. We realize that our beer is not the only product we provide, but a long lasting relationship between our company, employees, and customers. Aslin Beer Company doesn’t take itself too seriously. Any why should we? Beer is fun. It’s for kicking back: vacations, parties, hangouts. Along with the fun and humorous atmosphere, our founders’ have a passion and dedication to create a good product and have a commitment to provide the best beer to all passionate beer drinkers alike. Our company will craft only the highest quality ales, lagers, and ciders that will help redefine American beer culture, re-educate the consumer palate and revive people’s passion, and using the highest quality ingredients from around the world.

breweries.name: Terrapin Beer Company
breweries.description:
Terrapin Beer Company was born when two brewers met while working together at a microbrewery in Atlanta. Looking around at what other breweries in the SE were doing, Spike and John felt they could make a contribution. Realizing that anyone could make just another pale ale, brown ale or stout, Spike and John set their sights on crafting beers unlike any that were currently available in the SE.

Terrapin introduced its first beer, the Rye Pale Ale in April of 2002. Six months later while only available on draft in Athens, Terrapin’s sole offering won the American Pale Ale Gold Medal at the 2002 Great American Beer Festival.  Only six months old, Terrapin had arrived in style!

data.name: The Wedge
data.description: This winter seasonal is in the style of a Black IPA. It has the characteristics of an American IPA in having intense bold hop flavors with a twist of dark malt bringing out the roasted chocolate flavor. Three different types of hops and imported dark crystal malts are used to maximize this flavor and create fresh hop taste and aroma. It is dry-hopped in the fermenter to give it its great hop aroma. This brew was meant to be consumed immediately upon opening on that cold winter evening. Enjoy!

breweries.name: Left Coast Brewing
breweries.description:
Left Coast Brewing Company was formed in 2004 with a capacity of 5,500 bbls.  Since then, we have expanded our operation to 13,000 bbls with our current tanks.  Our main focus for the Left Coast are Hoppy Beers, Stouts, and German Lagers. We do however add new styles as part of our seasonal program and have one Belgian tripel ale.

We brew, bottle and keg everything in house at our San Clemente facility and our team is dedicated to the perfection of our product.

data.name: The Wheel: Red Drink
data.description: Tons of caramel malt gives this beer its color and caramel flavors & aromas. In order to overcome all the malt, we put even more hops into this beer to give it a wonderful piney aromas which come from the single hop variety named Centennial.

breweries.name: Ei8ht Ball Brewing
breweries.description:
Ei8ht Ball, named after the streets we got our
credit from, we are humble yet proud. Local but not
influenced. We might not move mountains, but we will
push the envelope. We will test theories and create
moments through our liquid in which tones and times
are our muse. We will brew and flow with poise and
confidence. We will rush for no one, yet hesitate for
nothing. We strive to please but make no apologies. No
billboards, neon lights and flashy text, it’s not our speed.
Make us part of your flight or enjoy us with a meal and
the mission is complete. For all of those in search of
something diverse, unique, improved and fresh, look
into, behind, under and around the Ei8ht Ball. What you
will find is what you never thought you were looking for.
This is Ei8ht Ball Brewing, the proof is the glass.

breweries.name: Oskar Blues Brewery
breweries.description: Oskar Blues Brewery is part of the Oskar Blues Grill and Brew restaurant and was located in Lyons, Colorado, near the city of Boulder. The brewery is now in Longmont, CO - a much larger town just east of Lyons. Oskar Blues is unique in that it serves craft-brewed beer in cans, contrary to the normal practice of bottling micro brews. The brewery is owned by Dale Katechis, a native of Florence, Alabama who brought canned beer and southern fried foods together for an interesting twist on the micro-brew pub.

breweries.name: Aftershock Brewing Company
breweries.description:
After 27 years of steady brewing, we thought it would be fun to share the results of the brewing experience with others.  We are a small brewery, and are truly “hands on” every step of the brewing process.  Our goal is to produce the best, most flavorful, most memorable local beers possible.  We think we’ve met that goal, & hope you’ll agree.

At Aftershock, we believe there are two different approaches to brewing.  The most common approach used by the major breweries is a ‘scientific one’.  All stages of the brewing process are closely monitored to ensure a consistent, if tasteless product.  Computers and other high tech equipment are more in control than the brewer himself.  With this approach you get ‘scientific’ beer.  The other approach is a more artistic one, while still respecting basic laws of science, and the need for spotless cleanliness.  That’s the approach we plan to always take at Aftershock.  At the risk of losing an undetectable amount of consistency, the result is beer with much more character, subtle nuances, and awesome flavor.  Don’t take our word for it; check us out.

data.name: Third Kingdom IPA
data.description: Our vision for a stellar IPA is one that is well-hopped yet malty, and most of all, thirst quenching. We understand that it can be fun to pack a grotesque amount of hops into a beer to say that it can be done, but we choose not to do that with our IPA.  We use hops where it’s appropriate.  We add pungent American hops throughout the boil to give us a solid base for an IPA and then dry-hop the beer during conditioning. During this stage, our IPA inherits a huge, aromatic hoppy nose.

breweries.name: Christian Moerlein Brewing Company
breweries.description: The Christian Moerlein Brewing Company was founded in Cincinnati, Ohio's Over-the-Rhine Brewery District in 1853 by its German immigrant namesake Mr. Christian Moerlein. By the end of the 19th-Century the brewery would be one of the largest in the United States. The brewery closed its doors when Prohibition began in 1919. The brand was revived in 1981 as one of the pioneer craft beers of todays craft beer movement, with the introduction of a series of Christian Moerlein beers by the Hudepohl Brewing Company. In 1984, Christian Moerlein Lager was the first American beer ever certified by the German government to pass the German Beer Purity Law (Reinheitsgebot). After a series of sales that took the business and brewing out of the region, the company was relocated once again to Cincinnati in 2004 by Gregory Hardman, its current local owner. With the goal of returning Cincinnati's grand brewing traditions, Hardman led the effort to build a world-class Moerlein Lager House brewery/gastropub on the banks of the Ohio River which opened in 2012 in Cincinnati's Smale Riverfront Park next to Great American Ballpark, home of the Cincinnati Reds. A spectacular craft brewing facility and Malt House Taproom opened in 2013 in the historic Over-the-Rhine brewery district, just blocks from its original 19th century home. The brewery offers tours and has a taproom in an original 1860's malt house complete with historic underground lagering cellars. The brewery is the first American craft brewer to rescue a City's heritage beer brands and owns Hudepohl-Schoenling Brewing Co. including the brands of Hudepohl, Hudy Delight, Hudy 14-K, Burger and Little Kings Cream Ale brands.

breweries.name: ThirstyBear Brewing Company
breweries.description: ThirstyBear Brewing Co. is San Francisco's only certified organic brewery.  ThirstyBear hand-crafts beers of every description: ales, lagers, barrel-aged, Belgian-inspired, cask conditioned, wet-hopped, dry-hopped - all inspired by tradition and modern creativity. Our brewery crafts only organic beers, ensuring that the beers you consume are good to you and good for our earth.  Our restaurant pairs its beers with Spanish inspired tapas and paellas sourced from the plethora of local and often organic farms that grace our region.  As the only San Francisco certified green brewery-restaurant, we promote the business of sustainability. Founded on September 13, 1996, ThirstyBear is now the oldest brewery-restaurant in San Francisco.

data.name: This Machine IPA
data.description:
Woody Guthrie was a legendary folksinger, American patriot, and an Oklahoma original. This Machine IPA is a tribute to Woody Guthrie and his iconic guitar with the slogan “This Machine Kills Fascists”. With this simple yet powerful message, Woody used the best weapons he had, his words and his guitar to help fight the ultimate war between good and evil.

This Machine IPA was brewed to further this spirit. Armed with Nelson Sauvin, Citra, and Amarillo hops as well as a fruit forward, estery and slightly phenolic yeast strain, This Machine IPA packs an aromatic explosion of flavor that stands up to the masses in support of craft brewers everywhere who are fighting for the freedom of taste! Join us raising a toast to Woody and his message that rings true today.

data.name: Threadless IPA
data.description: Our Threadless/Finch collaboration IPA is a balanced experience of both perceived hoppiness and true bitterness. It pours a darker amber color and finishes with a citrus flavor, and when combined, will require this to be the last IPA you ever drink! Well, maybe, we realize you will probably drink more, but the result of this recipe clearly evolves into a very balanced IPA. The grain bill on this big pale includes melanoidin and Victory malts. We hop it up before the boil starts with some Columbus first wort hopping, then add a bunch more for bittering.

breweries.name: Schooner Exact Brewing Company
breweries.description:
In 2006, homebrewing pals Marcus Connery and Matt & Heather McClung decided to take their hobby to the next level and go pro. Purchasing a half-barrel system, they began brewing a keg of beer at a time out of an ActivSpace unit under the West Seattle Bridge. Beginning in January 2007, they distributed their beer to restaurants and taprooms all over the city of Seattle.

As demand for their beers increased, the Schooner EXACT founders expanded into a larger, 10 -barrel system. The brewery moved to the South Park neighborhood in early 2009, and to its current SODO location on 1st Avenue in 2010. After Marcus Connery passed the reins of the brewery over to Heather and Matt to pursue the next chapter in his beer adventures by opening a beer broker/ consulting business, Matt and Heather quit their teaching jobs to pursue their brewery dreams full time.

data.description: This IPA is tuned perfectly to provide the hops bitterness explosion that IPA fans seek without a bitter aftertaste that can often linger on the palette. It is quickly becoming a house-favorite.

data.name: Three Peaks IPA
data.description: Off the horizon, south of unit gun, Three Peaks stands tall above the mesa. Three Peaks IPA is a tribute to the indomitable spirit of folks who carve out a life in the hard scrabble and mesa mud. With generous additions of Amarillo and Citra hops, we think you'll enjoy notes of pine and citrus in this beer as you watch the sunset over Three Peaks.

It’s taken almost one hundred years, but Evanston can once again call itself home to a Temperance movement. But this time there’s beer. In fact, this one is all about the beer. Aside from that tiny detail, Temperance has always been about making life better in ways big and small. We think that’s a worthy goal, and one that only comes about by being open to the possibilities. It’s something we think about with the beers we brew and the things we do. (And when you join us, you will too.)
Welcome to a new Temperance movement.

breweries.name: Red Door Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Red Door Brewing Company opened in Albuquerque in 2014. The company was founded by five original members who came together with the hopes of forming the greatest light jazz/thrash metal fusion band in history. When it turned out most of the members were terrible musicians the team re-evaluated their skills and decided to capitalize on Wayne and Rob’s extensive brewing experience, passion, and education, and open a brewery.

Red Door Brewing Company strives to create a warm, welcoming atmosphere where you can grab an ice-cold, delicious beer and relax after a solid day’s work. We absolutely guarantee an environment free of rampaging gangs of rabid badgers which feed off chaos and lust for nothing but a dystopic, badger-ruled hellscape of a future. We are notably the only brewery in Albuquerque who has made that promise.Red Door Brewing Company opened in Albuquerque in 2014. data.name: Thrill Seeker
data.description: Thrill Seeker is a "West Coast-style" India pale ale that is sure to push your senses to the edge. It starts with a base of American 2-row malt and a restrained dose of extra light caramel malt to let the hops punch though. It's then generously hopped with Chinook, Summit, Centennial, and Simcoe for a massive citrus and tropical hop profile. Thrill Seeker is dry hopped with Simcoe and Chinook for an über fresh resiny aroma.

breweries.name: Beachwood BBQ & Brewing
breweries.description:
At Beachwood BBQ & Brewing we take craft beer very seriously. As downtown Long Beach’s only independent craft brewery, we strive to make sure our passion for craft beer shines through with every sip.

Our award-winning Brewmaster, Julian Shrago, spends countless hours perfecting each recipe, researching new ones, and pushing the boundaries of craft beer brewing today. Our general philosophy on brewing is to always think of flavor first. No matter how creative you want to be, beer, much like food, must taste good (or hopefully outstanding).

We brew a wide variety of American styles, as well as some traditional British, German, and Belgian-style beers. Having a large variety of beers keeps customers excited and creates a sense of adventure associated with the brand. It also allows us to have unlimited creative freedom, and that always keeps things fresh. Cheers!

data.name: Thrilla In Brazilla
data.description: Thrilla in Brazilla is gold in color with a tight white head of foam.  The fruity-ester aroma is high to very high.  Hop aroma is further characterized by high amounts of citrus with a slightly resinous character in the background.  The aroma follows through to the taste with citrusy characters dancing on the palette, including the presence of fresh oranges.  Thrilla is a medium bodied beer with medium high hop bitterness.  As always, this beer is balanced.
data.foodPairings: A nice thick juicy hamburger with fresh jalepeno and serrano peppers.  The spice in the burger pairs amazingly well with the crisp citrusy hop character of Thrilla in Brazilla.

data.name: Thrust! An IPA
data.description:
Designed by NASA scientists, THRUST! is structured to attack you senses.
 
First, it burns into your visual cortex the image of a beer with a deep copper hue topped with a rocky white head. Soon your olfactory bulb should be awoken as the massive dry-hop propels a penetrating aroma of grapefruit, mango, grape, stone fruit and lychee hurling into your forebrain.
 
Resisting the impulse to keep smelling the beer, you pound back a gulp which illicits a poking and prodding of tropical fruit and resin on your taste buds.
 
Your pallet soon succumbs as THRUST! penetrates and perforates, eventually becoming your new reality.
data.foodPairings: To be honest…just have the beer!

Our objective is simple: We serve the finest, hand-crafted beers produced from a working, on-site brewery; we offer healthy, contemporary bistro-style cuisine; and we serve it all up in a fun, clean and friendly environment.

style.name: American-Style India Pale Ale
style.description: American-style India pale ales are perceived to have medium-high to intense hop bitterness, flavor and aroma with medium-high alcohol content. The style is further characterized by floral, fruity, citrus-like, piney, resinous, or sulfur-like American-variety hop character. Note that one or more of these American-variety hop characters is the perceived end, but the hop characters may be a result of the skillful use of hops of other national origins. The use of water with high mineral content results in a crisp, dry beer. This pale gold to deep copper-colored ale has a full, flowery hop aroma and may have a strong hop flavor (in addition to the perception of hop bitterness). India pale ales possess medium maltiness which contributes to a medium body. Fruity-ester flavors and aromas are moderate to very strong. Diacetyl can be absent or may be perceived at very low levels. Chill and/or hop haze is allowable at cold temperatures. (English and citrus-like American hops are considered enough of a distinction justifying separate American-style IPA and English-style IPA categories or subcategories. Hops of other origins may be used for bitterness or approximating traditional American or English character. See English-style India Pale Ale

breweries.name: Pyramid Breweries
breweries.description: Based in the Pacific Northwest, Pyramid Breweries began as Hart Brewing in 1984 and launched the flagship brand of Pyramid Ales.  In 1996, the company was reborn as Pyramid Breweries and currently offers craft beers produced under the Pyramid family of ales and lagers.  With breweries in Seattle, WA, Portland, OR, and Berkeley, CA, Pyramid also owns Alehouses at all three locations and an additional Alehouse in Walnut Creek, CA.

data.name: Thunderbeast
data.description: Don't let the pale color fool you, this classic West Coast India Pale Ale packs a sizable wallop of hop aroma. The nose explodes in citrus and hints of pine from the positively outrageous amounts of hops added. The body of California grown malted barley provides a subtle sweetness and the copious amounts of rye add a spice that compliments this very hop-forward beer.

available.name: Year Round
available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.
